name: Renaissance Lucerne Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed only one night (wish could stay longer) due to a tight schedule. We really like it. Its location is perfect: two blocks to train station and everything else is within a few minutes walk. It’s newly renovated from a hundred year old building on a main, tree-lined shopping street: classy outside and modern inside. The public areas are small as expected, but the room was large: a nice king size bed room facing the street, with a small iron-railed balcony. With window closed, we didn’t notice any noise during sleeping. We did sense the beats from the bar/club below and didn’t feel annoyed. The staff members speak very good English and were very attentive (we needed utensils for the desserts bought from a nearby bakery and they were delivered to our room in less than 5 minutes). The room has a nice wall size see-through window between the room and a surprisingly large bathroom. Unlike the one in Marriott Shanghai Center, however, this window doesn’t have a blind to block the view. For a couple, it’s OK. For a family, it may be a little inconvenient (probably, the window is only in the one bed room for a couple). We didn’t, as usual, have any meal in their restaurant.
reviews.title: The smallest Renaissance is a charm

reviews.title: Wonderful experience - best Renaissance I've every stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Front desk was very warm and welcoming upon arrival. Almost everyone speaks English so it is helpful for us non German speaking travelers. Location from the train station is only a few minutes walk and is just down the Pilatusstrasse. Hallways are narrow (adds charm) and my room was not big, but was adequate and comfortable. My criteria for a hotel is that the accommodations are clean, fresh (not worn), and modern (decor and tech-wise). This hotel did not disappoint in respect to these points. I did want to note that I could smell cigarette smoke periodically. It was light and infrequent, but I have a sensitivity to it and could smell it.
reviews.title: Great option while in Lucerne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other nearby conveniences include the train station shopping area, which is open on Sundays and late into the evening, so if you want a baked item or drink, it's just a few minutes walk. There is also a McDonalds, BurgerKing, and Starbucks around the corner, so if you are needing a bit of home - it's just a moment away.
reviews.title: Best hotel stay ever!

reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend staying here and would do so again should I return to the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and the staff is just amazingly friendly and accomodating. Their General Manager, Kevin Salt, makes it a point to be present and accessible to all guests.
reviews.title: Typical Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am struggling how to rate this hotel. I was upgraded to a larger corner room on the 4th floor - very nice-though a work colleagues regular room was quite small. I deducted a point from the review for one reason: I could hear the hotel bar's thumping music until after 12:30 in the morning on a Saturday night. Seriously- it took 3 calls to get them to turn down the volume and the bass. And then they told me that I needed to give them some time to take care of it. Seriously - why put someone in that room when you know they will not be able to sleep!!! I don't know how often this happens
reviews.title: Excellent except hotel bar far too loud at midnight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Great stay, fantastic location!

reviews.title: Not great..

reviews.text: Location is great - downtown and near the train station.
reviews.title: Well renovated, boutique Renaissance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First hotel we stayed in for our 2-week Switzerland trip. Location was fantastic, less than 5 minutes walk from the main train station (even with luggage) and to the river. Our room was very spacious and bright, and nicely decorated with comfortable bedding and pillows. Very spacious bathroom as well. Not much of a view (faced some other buildings) but didn't bother us. Good range of food for breakfast in the nice hotel restaurant. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great stay in a modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel after driving for 13 hours as Luzern was our stop of our road trip to Greece last summer. We were all tired and hungry wanting to relax have some room service and clean ourselves. When we arrived at night it was raining heavily and we had to take the children in side in a hurry so that they don't get wet. First surprise was that there is no valet service, noone to greet us or help us take the bags out of the car and into the hotel. My poor husband had to park outside the hotel while the receptionist warned him that he has to move the car asap otherwise he will get a ticket... So my husband was rushing in and out trying to unload the car and once that was done he had to find a place to park the car (it took him ages and he got lost a couple of times). The staff never offered to help him. The room was clean, it had a stale smell so I had to keep the windows open, the room service was limited and average. The breakfast buffet was ok and the ladies at the restaurant very sweet and helpful. For a short stay it was ok for a longer stay I would definitely prefer to stay in one of the hotels on the lake they must have incredible views.
reviews.title: Would have appreciated the staff's help when needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner for one night as we were seeing a band at Sudpol. The hotel is lovely, great location - close to the main station and walking distance to the old town. We even walked to the transport museum, it took about 30mins and if you're not in a hurry it's worth the walk, LOTS of beautiful scenery to photograph.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a standard room, which was comfortable, clean, the bed was nearly as comfortable as the Pullman Cologne but not quite. I've yet to find a bed more comfortable than the Pullman Cologne so second place is not to be sniffed at!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Renaissance Luzern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fairly small but a good selection and delicious! The hot food was replaced/filled regularly so you weren't eating eggs that have been sat out for hours.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luzern is a beautiful city and the Renaissane hotel is a beautiful place to stay. Based on this experience I would stay in another Renaissance hotel.
reviews.title: Good value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Good but not great

description: Renaissance Lucerne Hotel - a superior, first-class hotel offering a blend of personalised, stylish ambiance and cutting-edge technical amenities. Fine dining at the Renaissance Lucerne Hotel in the restaurant PACIFICO: Enjoy ever-popular fajitas, juicy steaks, home-smoked spare ribs and Cajun wings in a unique ambiance. Spacious and tasteful decor.
